intro: Galium parisiense subsp. tenellum, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, prostrate stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming from June to August. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
